name.japanese: イヌイヌの実 モデル:ジャッカル
name.romanized: Inu Inu no Mi, Moderu: Jakkaru

abilities.description: Allows the user to transform into a full jackal or a human-jackal hybrid form at will.
Grants increased strength, speed, and sensory perception in transformed states.
A technique where Chaka transforms into full jackal form, grips his sword in his mouth, and charges at opponents with powerful slashing attacks.

weaknesses.weakness: Standard Devil Fruit weaknesses (seawater, Sea-Prism Stone)
weaknesses.description: Like all Devil Fruit users, becomes powerless in seawater and when exposed to Sea-Prism Stone.

weaknesses.weakness: Ineffective against Logia users without Haki
weaknesses.description: Physical attacks cannot harm Logia users who can turn their bodies intangible.

culturalSignificance: Represents Anubis from Egyptian mythology, fitting with Alabasta's Egyptian-inspired theme. Chaka is considered one of Alabasta's two guardian deities alongside Pell (who has a falcon fruit representing Horus).

keyMoments.description: Chaka reveals his Devil Fruit powers for the first time by transforming into his jackal form to attack Crocodile.
keyMoments.significance: First on-screen demonstration of the Inu Inu no Mi, Model: Jackal.

reveals.information: Chaka possesses a Zoan-type Devil Fruit allowing jackal transformation
The fruit grants enhanced physical abilities suitable for combat
Physical attacks from the fruit are ineffective against Crocodile's Logia sand body
